713438f-a.title: Manhattan: 50th Street (East) - 2nd Avenue
713438f-a.text:
(1)
305-327 East 50th Street, at, adjoining, and east of the
N.E. corner of Second Ave. The Elevated Station at 50th Street
is shown in the background and also the Beekman Hill Methodist
Episcopal Church (Nos. 317-319).
September 20, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, showing only Nos. 309-327.
June 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
Tis edifice was purchased (about 1920) by the First Reformed
Episcopal Church, formerly located at the N. E. corner of Madison
Avenue and E. 55th Street. For details of same--see Page 390-1
of Moses Kings Handbook of N. Y. 1893.

713483f-a.title: Manhattan: 50th Street (West) - 2nd Avenue
713483f-a.text:
125 E. 50th St. eg. A-240 July 15,1941
P.L.Sperr

707877f-b.title: Manhattan: 2nd Ave. - 50th St. E.
707877f-b.text:
(1)
Second Ave., west side, at East 50th Street, showing the downtown
platform of the 50th Street station of the Second Ave. Elevated Line.
The view is in a southwesterly direction, and shows (from left to right)
the Chrysler; Empire State and Lincoln Buildings.
December 28, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, as seen from a point slightly southward.
December 28, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
